perturbation.original_text: This agreement ("Agreement") is made by and between Erchonia Corporation. ("Erchonia") whose address is 650 Atlantis Rd., Melbourne, Florida, USA, 32904 and InnerScope Hearing Technologies Inc, ("Distributor") whose address is 2151 Professional Drive, Second Floor, Roseville, California, USA, 95661 hereafter referred to collectively as the ("Parties").
perturbation.changed_text: This agreement ("Agreement") is made by and between Erchonia Corporation. ("Erchonia") whose address is 650 Atlantis Rd., Melbourne, Florida, USA, 32904 and InnerScope Hearing Technologies Inc, ("Vendor") whose address is 2151 Professional Drive, Second Floor, Roseville, California, USA, 95661 hereafter referred to collectively as the ("Parties").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Vendor' without defining that they are the same entity, potentially causing confusion about the roles and responsibilities assigned to each party throughout the agreement. This creates uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
1. Grant of License.

a. Subject to the terms set forth in this agreement, Erchonia grants Distributor the exclusive, non- transferable right and license to promote, distribute and sell the Products identified in Exhibit A to those type of customer specified in Exhibit B and only within the Territory specified in Exhibit B. Distributor shall only distribute or sell the Products to customers who are licensed health care professionals and meet the other requirements set forth in Exhibit B.

b. Erchonia retains the right, in its sole discretion, to add, delete, upgrade, or modify the Products from time to time. Upon receipt of notice of such change, Distributor shall cease to market and distribute earlier versions of the Products and/or Products deleted from Schedule A. Distributor will deliver, at Erchonia's expense, all recalled, discontinued or products otherwise rendered unmarketable (under the terms of this paragraph) to Erchonia. Erchonia will fully reimburse Distributor for all costs related to the cost of materials and products returned to Erchonia
perturbation.changed_text:
1. Grant of License.

a. Subject to the terms set forth in this agreement, Erchonia grants Retailer the exclusive, non- transferable right and license to promote, distribute and sell the Products identified in Exhibit A to those type of customer specified in Exhibit B and only within the Territory specified in Exhibit B. Retailer shall only distribute or sell the Products to customers who are licensed health care professionals and meet the other requirements set forth in Exhibit B.

b. Erchonia retains the right, in its sole discretion, to add, delete, upgrade, or modify the Products from time to time. Upon receipt of notice of such change, Retailer shall cease to market and distribute earlier versions of the Products and/or Products deleted from Schedule A. Retailer will deliver, at Erchonia's expense, all recalled, discontinued or products otherwise rendered unmarketable (under the terms of this paragraph) to Erchonia. Erchonia will fully reimburse Retailer for all costs related to the cost of materials and products returned to Erchonia
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is replaced by 'Retailer' in section 1. Since the term is now used in section 1 with section header, it would introduce confusion with definition in section 1, and definition in section 2. The obligations of each party are less clear. It becomes difficult to enforce the contract because of ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text:
b. Erchonia Warranty and Warranty Limitations: Other than the written warranty accompanying the Products, Erchonia DISCLAIMS ALL OTHER REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT OF THIRD PARTY INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS.

c. IN NO EVENT SHALL Erchonia BE LIABLE FOR ANY LOSS OF PROFIT OR ANY OTHER COMMERCIAL DAMAGE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR OTHER INDIRECT DAMAGES UNDER ANY CAUSE OF ACTION ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, CLAIMS ARISING FROM MALFUNCTION OR DEFECTS IN THE PRODUCTS.
perturbation.changed_text:
b. Erchonia Warranty and Warranty Limitations: Other than the written warranty accompanying the Goods, Erchonia DISCLAIMS ALL OTHER REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT OF THIRD PARTY INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS.

c. IN NO EVENT SHALL Erchonia BE LIABLE FOR ANY LOSS OF PROFIT OR ANY OTHER COMMERCIAL DAMAGE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL OR OTHER INDIRECT DAMAGES UNDER ANY CAUSE OF ACTION ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, CLAIMS ARISING FROM MALFUNCTION OR DEFECTS IN THE Goods.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'Products' with 'Goods' in section 10 (b) and (c), without defining Goods in the Definitions section, creates uncertainty if 'Goods' has broader or narrower interpretation than 'Products' as defined in Schedule A. This can introduce dispute during claim regarding malfunction or defects in the Products.
